alert.note: Alert for Lamar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 09 at 3:46AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lamar County through 430 AM CST... At 345 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Paris and another near Roxton. Both storms are moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paris, Blossom, Roxton, Lake Crook, Powderly, Sumner, Lake Gibbons, Pattonville, Arthur City, Pat Mayse Lake, Camp Maxey, Forest Hill, Novice, Toco, Sun Valley, Midcity, Petty, Globe, Brookston and Atlas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
